Jul 6, 2020 08:46

‘You can’t blame it on police’, Atlanta mayor says after 8yo black girl shot dead during protest

The mayor of Atlanta, Georgia gave an impassioned plea to disclose any information on the gunmen who shot up a car, killing an eight-year-old black girl inside, during a BLM protest.

  • Electoral College takes a hit: US Supreme Court rules states can PUNISH electors who ignore popular vote results

    The Supreme Court has unanimously ruled that state governments have the right to penalize so-called ‘faithless electors’, members of the Electoral College who do not support the victor of their states’ popular presidential vote.

  • Statue for black abolitionist Frederick Douglass in NY state beyond repair after it was ripped down by vandals (PHOTOS)
